title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Instructor: Joel Nitta



Born and raised in California
Fourth generation Japanese-American
First came to Japan as high school exchange student

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Ice-breaker

Answer the question: “Why are you interested in biodiversity?”
Introduce yourself and discuss with your neighbor

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What is biodiversity?

The different kinds of life that occur on our planet



Often we talk about the number of species, but it has other definitions too

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?



How would you feel if you could never visit a natural place like a forest or the mountains?




https://images.unsplash.com/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?



How would you feel if you knew that a place like the Great Barrier Reef were to disappear?




https://www.nma.gov.au/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biodiversity has inherent value

Biodiversity has inherent value: it is worth something just by existing
Biodiversity has cultural value: we derive inspiration from it

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?



How would you feel if you couldn’t eat any fruit because there were no bees to pollinate flowers?




https://upload.wikimedia.org/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Humans depend on biodiversity



How would you feel if you didn’t have access to clean drinking water because there were no wetlands to help filter it?




https://upload.wikimedia.org/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why does biodiversity matter?

Biodiversity provides ecosystem services: humans benefit from the natural environment

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biodiversity is in danger
We will learn about the specific risks posed to biodiversity, and actionable measures to counteract them.


Climate change
Population growth
Invasive species

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biodiversity in Japan



Did you know that Japan is a biodiversity hotspot?
Do you know why?




https://hanwellzoo.co.uk/

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Japan as a biodiversity hotspot
Japan has a wide variation of climates in a small area


Species are usually adapted for one particular kind of climate
This results in many species

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Goals of this class
By the end of the course, you will be able to:

understand the processes generating biodiversity
explain how biodiversity is distributed globally and in Japan
propose ways to effectively conserve biodiversity

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Expectations of this class

I expect you to participate in discussions
I expect you to ask questions

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Language of this class

This class is conducted in English
But, you can ask questions in Japanese and I will explain in Japanese if needed
日本語でも必要に応じて大丈夫です。
とにかく何か分からないことがあったら、聞いてください！

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Structure of this class

Classic model: Introduce new ideas in class then complete homework assignments about them
Flipped model: Introduce new ideas ahead of class in videos, and we will learn more about those topics in depth through in-class discussions

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Videos

We will watch videos from a series on biodiversity produced by the California Academy of Sciences
Each is video is 5-10 minutes long.
There are usually 3-4 videos per week.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Intro video


https://www.youtube.com/embed/HpDJBFflYKI

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Quizzes

There will be a short quiz (ca. 5-10 min.) on the content of the video at the start of each class.
Bring your laptop or smartphone to take the quiz on Socrative.

Understanding the Past to Preserve the Future

title: Day 1: Introduction to “Biodiversity and Japan”
text:
2023-06-13





Research topic 1: Ecology and evolution of ferns
Research topic 2: Development of software for data science











Born and raised in California
Fourth generation Japanese-American
First came to Japan as high school exchange student









Answer the question: “Why are you interested in biodiversity?”
Introduce yourself and discuss with your neighbor




https://climate.copernicus.eu





The different kinds of life that occur on our planet

. . .

Often we talk about the number of species, but it has other definitions too







How would you feel if you could never visit a natural place like a forest or the mountains?




https://images.unsplash.com/









How would you feel if you knew that a place like the Great Barrier Reef were to disappear?




https://www.nma.gov.au/







Biodiversity has inherent value: it is worth something just by existing
Biodiversity has cultural value: we derive inspiration from it







How would you feel if you couldn’t eat any fruit because there were no bees to pollinate flowers?




https://upload.wikimedia.org/









How would you feel if you didn’t have access to clean drinking water because there were no wetlands to help filter it?




https://upload.wikimedia.org/







Biodiversity provides ecosystem services: humans benefit from the natural environment




We will learn about the specific risks posed to biodiversity, and actionable measures to counteract them.


Climate change
Population growth
Invasive species








Did you know that Japan is a biodiversity hotspot?
Do you know why?




https://hanwellzoo.co.uk/






Japan has a wide variation of climates in a small area


Species are usually adapted for one particular kind of climate
This results in many species





By the end of the course, you will be able to:

understand the processes generating biodiversity
explain how biodiversity is distributed globally and in Japan
propose ways to effectively conserve biodiversity





I expect you to participate in discussions
I expect you to ask questions





This class is conducted in English
But, you can ask questions in Japanese and I will explain in Japanese if needed
日本語でも必要に応じて大丈夫です。
とにかく何か分からないことがあったら、聞いてください！





Classic model: Introduce new ideas in class then complete homework assignments about them
Flipped model: Introduce new ideas ahead of class in videos, and we will learn more about those topics in depth through in-class discussions





We will watch videos from a series on biodiversity produced by the California Academy of Sciences
Each is video is 5-10 minutes long.
There are usually 3-4 videos per week.






https://www.youtube.com/embed/HpDJBFflYKI





There will be a short quiz (ca. 10 min.) on the content of the video at the start of each class.
Bring your laptop or smartphone to take the quiz on Socrative.





Visit https://gosocrative.com and enter room name NITTA9359, or scan the barcode:

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Quiz

Visit https://gosocrative.com and enter room name NITTA9359, or scan the barcode:

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What are species anyways?
All of our discussion of biodiversity uses species as a unit (単位)

But what are species?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Species concepts

There is no one right answer to the question, “What are species?”
Instead, there are different species concepts

種概念、「種」の定義

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biological Species Concept (BSC)

According to the BSC, species are groups of individuals that can interbreed and produce fertile offspring

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why the BSC?

Members of the same species can exchange genes
Members of different species cannot
Member of the same species are an evolutionary unit

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Why measure biodiversity using species?


Conceptually simple
According to the BSC, we are preserving evolutionary units

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Are there any disadvantages to measuring biodiversity with species richness?
text:
Are there any disadvantages to measuring biodiversity with species richness?


Does not account for evolutionary history
The BSC is difficult to test experimentally
The BSC does not apply to all organisms

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Counting biodiversity

Population size (abundance): The number of individuals belonging to a species 個体数
Biomass: The total mass of organisms 生物量
Richness: The number of species 種数

To conserve biodiversity, we focus on richness

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Counting biodiversity


Biomass: The total mass of organisms 生物量

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Counting biodiversity


Richness: The number of species in an area 種数

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Counting biodiversity

Population size (abundance): The number of individuals belonging to a species 個体数
Biomass: The total mass of organisms 生物量
Richness: The number of species in an area 種数

To conserve biodiversity, we focus on richness

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Species richness is distributed unevenly
Some areas have many species, others don’t.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: There are many factors that determine richness
text:
There are many factors that determine richness

Climate 気候
Biotic interactions 生物間相互作用
Evolution 進化
Humans

These affect ranges of individual species, and species richness

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Hotspots are areas of exceptionally high richness
text:
Hotspots are areas of exceptionally high richness
Hotspots have high richness and are in danger: these are the areas that we should focus on conserving

種の数が極めて多い
すでにダメージを受けている

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
How do you experience biodiversity?
In your group, discuss:

Where do you see/experience areas of high biodiversity?
Where do you see/experience areas of low biodiversity?
Why do you think there is a difference?

One person per group answer on Socrative

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Why does the distribution of species richness vary in space?
text:
Why does the distribution of species richness vary in space?

Different species are adapted for different environments
Only a few species can handle extreme environments

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Why does the distribution of species richness vary in space?
text:
Why does the distribution of species richness vary in space?

productivity

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Why does the distribution of species richness vary in space?
text:
Why does the distribution of species richness vary in space?

time

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: The clearest pattern in richness is the latitudinal species gradient
text:
The clearest pattern in richness is the latitudinal species gradient

Species richness increases going from the poles to the equator
Due to

environmental conditions (including human influence)
energy
evolutionary time

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Hotspots are areas of remarkably high biodiversity
text:
Hotspots are areas of remarkably high biodiversity

We can’t conserve everything
Hotspots are areas to prioritize for conservation

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Population size (abundance)

The number of individuals belonging to a species 個体数

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Biomass

The total mass of organisms 生物量

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Richness

The number of species 種数

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
What is biodiversity?

The different kinds of life that occur on our planet

To understand biodiversity, we need to document it (describe where it occurs)

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: How can we count (quantify) life?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Latitudinal species gradient
The number of species increases going from the poles to the equator

latitude = 緯度
equator = 赤道

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Latitudinal species gradient


https://en.wikipedia.org/, https://www.worldatlas.com

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Latitudinal species gradient

Mammal richness 哺乳類の種数
Schipper et al. 2008, Science 225–230

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:

In your group, discuss:

One person per group answer on Socrative

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Counting life

Population size (abundance): The number of individuals belonging to a species 個体数
Biomass: The total mass of organisms 生物量
Richness: The number of species 種数

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text:
Species richness is unevenly distributed
Some areas have many species, others have few.

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: 35 Global Biodiversity Hotspots

title: Biodiversity and Japan
text: Activity: Which is more diverse?

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Species richness is often used, but is not the only way to measure biodiversity
text:
Species richness is often used, but is not the only way to measure biodiversity
There is no single definition of diversity.
How you measure it depends on your goal and the data available

title: Biodiversity and Japan
section: Biological Species Concept (BSC)生物学的種概念
text:
Biological Species Concept (BSC)生物学的種概念

According to the BSC, species are groups of individuals that can interbreed with each other, but not other species

interbreed = 繁殖する

Appearance does not matter

見た目は関係ない

section: Western meadowlark vs. Eastern meadowlark (different species)
text:

text:
